comments.commentBody: It's Trump clever  ploy...shift blame and attention to others   while the Russian probe, Jeff Sessions and other indiscretions  escapes.... Trump played the media 'like a fiddle'
Why are you downplaying there is no proof? Of course there is none. Trump never utters a truthful statement.

This is all remarkably unremarkable.

Trump’s comment is based on a Breitbart article mentioning the wiretapping charge.

http://www.breitbart.com/big-government/2017/03/03/mark-levin-obama-used...

The allegations aren’t particularly different from what has already been well-published in the NY Times and elsewhere.

The FBI investigated the Trump campaign for possible Russian connections. The wiretapping was part of that investigation. They allege that a first FISA request was rejected for being too broad, but a second, more narrow request was approved in October based on the possibility of connection between the server in Trump Tower and a Russian bank. The wiretapping yielded no evidence of a connection. The FBI confirmed this last year without specifically mentioning a wiretap.

Everything else in the article covers what the NY Times and other sources have already reported.

Read between the lines of Obama’s spokesperson’s denial. It doesn’t say that Trump wasn’t wiretapped. It merely says that Obama didn’t order it. It says that the administration never “interfered with any independent investigation” by the Justice Department. Likely translation: The FBI wiretapped Trump, but Obama didn’t specifically request it.

Invalid reasoning, Mr. John. No one has to read between the lines of Trump's crazy tweet to know that Trump accuses President Obama of wiretapping. And he explodes win a flurry of twitter. His reactions are not within the realm of normal behavior—experts have discerned multiple disorders in the man. (By the way, that's wiretapp in Trumpese.) And if you don't find that pathologically lying president that is Trump accusing any former president, let alone one known for his integrity and rectitude, remarkable you might try reading up on presidential history.

bes:

You misunderstand, I think.

My comment is fundamentally pro-Obama (even though I'm not a particular fan).

I'm saying that wiretapping probably occurred and it was done legally. Obama may or may not have ordered the investigation, but almost certainly didn't personally order the wiretap.

A lot of this seems to be just harum-scarum stuff to keep his naysayers intoxicated on their outrage. Or he's buddying up to the American Dental
Association; all those gnashing teeth are gonna merit a few extra trips to
the dentist.
Hey, GOP:  how's that trump workin' out, for ya????  Proud, much???

First Mr Obama was to kind too you because I would have you treated same way you treated  him with disrespect . You are bad example Donald Trump maybe the Russia tap your phone you treated Mrs Clinton bad . You are not fit for president. Always blame somebody else you should thought about before you ran.
Well this is new. I'm so much more used to manufactured *foreign* crises to wag the dog.
Are there no patriots in the Congress who will step up to deal with this very dangerous man who can launch a nuclear attack? I am a Republican who is scared for my country

It's obviously a lie invented to distract from the Russian connection.

NYT -- keep on that Russia story, don't get distracted. trump wouldn't come up with this nonsense if the Russia story didn't scare him. We need those tax returns.

Maybe he believes his phone was tapped because: "How else would they know about my Russian ties?!?!" I keep thinking this whole Russian/Trump conspiracy just is too crazy to be true, but then Trump and Company keep acting so darn guilty!

When I was in high school, I was a terrible liar. When I'd come home late and drunk from a party, I'd casually announce "Just so you know, I wasn't drinking." And then I'd be grounded. Apparently, my folks are sharper than most of the republicans in congress.
rThe problem is that if you're an impulse-ridden character, you're not thinking of the consequences. You are purely id-driven

Trump flipped out about Sessions recusing himself because a major firewall came down. He picked Sessions to shield himself. We here in Canada had the cartoon preview (Mayor Rob Ford) to your blockbuster feature. Same man, same message (STOP THE GRAVY TRAIN!) and very soon - the same tragic outcome. It's not that complicated: Ford was not ready for the job, neither is Trump. I love the USA, but you are about to experience the worst political nightmare of your (our) lifetimes.

Yep. That's the answer. Despite "no evidence of any wrongdoing," let's start closed-door "investigations" where witnesses and targets are not entitled to legal representation based upon the random, unsupported tweets of a President who should have better things to do than sharing every random thought on twitter. And, let's start with the assumption "illegal politically motivated wire taps" actually exist. Despite the lack of any evidence of wrongdoing, let's threaten people with contempt charges and possible imprisonment.

A paraphrase of Monty Python seems appropriate for this farce -- "No one expects the Trumpian Inquisition.'
Dear real President Obama:  you Sir, ROCK.
super, our best hope is that he brings himself down, first. We survived Nixon. We can muddle through again.
For the good of the nation, Melania needs to move to the White House and calm this man down.

If you really want to be dumbfounded then visit the websites of fox news and breitbart news. The comments sections will blow your mind. The conspiracy theorists abound. Obama is being taken to Area 51 in a UFO, etc. Americans have become idiots since Reagan. It's so disheartening.

A sincere aversaion to abortion should lead to a deeper commitment to birth control if that were really the case.  Mr. Pence and his allies are definitely opposed to abortions and, while not publically stating their oppositition to it often, definitely opposed to providing birth control.  This position doesn't make sense if  the aim is to reduce abortions by allowing women control over when or if they get pregnant.  This is a control the GOP is reluctant to cede to women, hence their desire to close women's clinics even those that don't provide abortions which are never paid for with government funds, in any case.  Apparently a sexually empowered women is the worst nightmare for these gentlemen or else they are completely unable to understand simple arithmatic. Sexual activity minus birth control=more unplanned pregnancies.  More unplanned pregnaices=more abortions (legal or not)  Sexual activity+ brith control =fewer unplanned pregancies.  Fewer unplaned pregnancies= fewer abortions.  Simple.  Unless the problem is not reducing abortions but reducing or controlling female sexual activity, with the threat of an unwanted pregnacy as the cudgel.
If the Justice Department (not Obama) wiretapped Trump, it was because they believed he was the agent of a hostile foreign government or was guilty of serious crimes.  Or both.

You seem to be confusing wiretapping with the NSA's collection of bulk call data, two very different things.  A federal wiretap requires FISA court approval, which a President can't request, as mentioned by numerous articles from various sources today.  Trump's tweet is baloney.

What will it take to rid us of this tsunami Trump storm and put his supporters in recovery?  Every day, he reveals more dimensions of his mental instability and takes our country farther from its principles.  The only thing we can be sure of is that our country and most of it citizens are at the mercy of the mentally ill person we elected to the presidency.
People who puts up lies with no proof should be suit until they are out of business.
100 chimpanzees tweeting at 4AM couldn't write the stuff Trump writes, their messages would be a whole lot saner.

OK, tweets like these, kind of nuts, but we know the cast of characters, so we can just sort of shake our heads and speculate about Trump’s mental state.  But someday soon, he’s going to have to make a decision in the international arena that’s going to mean life, death, war or, god forbid, nuclear weapons.  So when does his mental state become a serious consideration?  When do we start thinking it may be too dangerous for him to be in the White House?

~
Can we skip the preliminaries and go straight to impeachment?
